author: NewsBreak Original
title: California man charged for threatening North Carolina individuals, synagogues
text:
By Mike Heuer ,
15 minutes ago May 25 (UPI) -- A California man was arrested Friday for allegedly making bomb threats against synagogues and a sheriff's department in North Carolina.
Attorney General Merrick Garland announced the arrest Friday of a California man charged with communicating threats against individuals, law enforcement and synagogues in North Carolina. File Photo by Bonnie Cash/UPI Kevin Dunlow, 62, of Huntington Beach also allegedly made multiple threats against individuals while in California, including an elected official and law enforcement, local media reported.
Dunlow was charged in a criminal complaint filed Friday in the U.S. District Court for Eastern North Carolina.
"Hate-fueled, violent threats endanger the safety of individuals and entire communities," Attorney General Merrick Garland said in a news release .
Dunlow "is accused of making explicit and detailed threats, ranging from making a bomb threat against the Wake County Sheriff's Office to threatening an elected official," Garland said.
Dunlow also is accused of making anti-Semitic threats on May 7 when he allegedly said "Jews didn't deserve to live" and "didn't deserve to be on this Earth."
Garland said Dunlow told a Rabbi he was "coming to the temple to kill all the Jews and children."
Dunlow is charged with illegally sending a threat to intentionally harm or kidnap another person.
He also is charged with illegally knowingly making false threats about bombs.
Each charges carries a maximum sentence of five years imprisonment.
Dunlow has an initial appearance in federal court Friday, and a detention hearing will be held at a later date.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Miguel Ángel Marcos
title: El Ayuntamiento licita distintos servicios y suministros para el Carnaval
text:
Se acerca el Carnaval 2025, que se celebrará del 28 de febrero al 5 de marzo, y por ello se aceleran los preparativos previos, como la elección del cartel anunciador, que ya se tiene; la convocatoria de las subvenciones para confeccionar los trajes de las candidatas a reinas; la inscripción de carrozas, comparsas y murgas o la promoción de la fiesta, la más reciente el miércoles en la Feria Internacional de Turismo.
En paralelo se sigue con el procedimiento administrativo para contratar otros asuntos menos llamativos pero igualmente necesarios para el desarrollo de la fiesta. En concreto suministros y distintos servicios, que el Ayuntamiento acaba de sacar a concurso por importe de casi 82.000 euros.
La licitación se ha dividido en diez lotes, cada uno con un importe diferente. Son alquiler de carpas, con 17.666 euros; suministro de la figura de la sardina, 1.694 euros; alquiler de seis módulos sanitarios portátiles y dos para camerinos, 7.381; servicio de comida popular, 14.850; alquiler y colocación de sillas, 7.018; lotes de productos ibéricos, 6.930; fotografía, 2.178; decoración carrozas de reinas, 2.783; servicio de vigilantes de seguridad, 10.527 y disco móvil, 10.890, todo con IVA incluido.
El único criterio a valorar por la mesa de contratación es el precio en todos los lotes, salvo en uno: los vigilantes de seguridad. Aquí, además del precio, se tendrán en cuenta las mejoras, como bolsa de horas, política de calidad propia avalado por certificado o compromiso de asistencia en menos de dos horas.
El plazo de presentación de ofertas se cerrará el día 6.
Emisión del Carnaval
A este concurso hay que unir otro anterior para contratar la producción, grabación y emisión por 'streaming' del Carnaval, con un coste de 22.385 euros. Aquí el plazo terminará el 4 de febrero.

author: translator
title: Younger Generations Will Suffer Significantly More from Weather Extremes
text:
Those born in 2020 are more likely to face extreme heatwaves than older generations. Even if global warming could be stabilized at 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, an estimated 52 percent of today's five-year-olds would be affected by heatwaves in an unprecedented way. In comparison, the proportion for people born in 1960 is only 16 percent. This is reported by a research team led by Luke Grant from the Vrije Universiteit in Brussels in the journal "Nature".
As a result of climate change, there is a measurable increase in more and more severe extreme weather events. "Human influences have been identified in heatwaves, river floods, droughts, crop failures, as well as certain aspects of wildfires and tropical cyclones," the team writes. However, little research has been done so far on how strongly individual people will be affected by such events. The researchers used climate models and demographic data, among other things, to predict the number of people who will be exposed to an unprecedented burden from extreme events over the course of their lives.
What Global Warming Means for People in the Future Grant and colleagues considered three scenarios in which the average surface temperature of the Earth in 2100 is increased by 1.5 degrees, 2.5 degrees, and 3.5 degrees compared to pre-industrial times. They modeled what the different scenarios mean for people of different birth years.
Globally, of the people born in 2020, in the 1.5-degree scenario, 52 percent (about 62 million) will be exposed to an unprecedented burden from heatwaves in their lifetime. In the 3.5-degree scenario, it would even be 92 percent (111 million). 29 percent would then experience an unprecedented burden from crop failures and 14 percent from river floods. If all commitments to combat global warming made by states during climate conferences are met, the Earth will warm by 2.7 degrees by 2100, according to researchers.
If, instead, further reductions in greenhouse gases were to push global warming to 1.5 degrees by 2100, 613 million people born between 2003 and 2020 would be spared an unprecedented burden from heatwaves. In terms of crop failures, it would be 98 million, for river floods 64 million, for tropical cyclones 76 million, for droughts 26 million, and for wildfires 17 million. "Our results call for a comprehensive and sustainable reduction in greenhouse gas emissions to reduce the burden of climate change on today's young generations," the study authors write.
Further Results of the Study The team defines an unprecedented burden from extreme events as a probability of less than 1 in 10,000 that a person would experience the same burden from the respective extreme events in a world without climate change. The authors also point out certain limitations of the study - for example, that factors such as internal migration were not considered.
The team led by Grant also found differences between people in poorer and wealthier countries. This aspect is particularly emphasized by Rosanna Gualdi and Raya Muttarak from the Università di Bologna (Italy) in a commentary, also in "Nature": "In a scenario with a warming of 2.7 degrees and current policies, people in the socio-economically most vulnerable group - those with high poverty levels and low gross domestic product - are consistently more exposed to heatwaves than other groups."
(APA/Red.)
This article has been automatically translated, read the original article here .

author: dpa-AFX
title: Microsoft nennt erstmals Umsatz von Cloud-Plattform | MarketScreener Deutschland
text:
REDMOND (dpa-AFX) - Microsoft hat nach jahrelanger Geheimniskrämerei den Umsatz seiner Cloud-Plattform Azure öffentlich gemacht. Demnach brachte sie im gerade abgeschlossenen Geschäftsjahr Erlöse von mehr als 75 Milliarden Dollar - ein Plus von 34 Prozent. Damit bestätigt sich die Annahme, dass Microsoft die Nummer zwei im Cloud-Geschäft nach Amazon ist. Bisher nannte der Konzern nur die Zuwachsraten, nicht aber die absolute Umsatzzahl.
Über Azure liefert Microsoft Rechenleistung, Speicher und Anwendungen mit Künstlicher Intelligenz aus dem Netz an seine Kunden. Der heutige Chef Satya Nadella hatte den Windows- und Office-Konzern konsequent auf das Cloud-Geschäft ausgerichtet. Allein für das laufende Quartal kündigte Finanzchefin Amy Hood Kapitalinvestitionen von mehr als 30 Milliarden Dollar an, die zu einem großen Teil in Rechenzentren gehen werden.
Beschleunigtes Wachstum
Im vergangenen Quartal wuchs der Software-Riese dank der hohen Nachfrage nach Produkten rund um Künstliche Intelligenz und Cloud noch einmal schneller. In den drei Monaten bis Ende Juni stieg der Umsatz um 18 Prozent auf etwas mehr als 76 Milliarden Dollar (66 Mrd Euro). Der Gewinn sprang um fast ein Viertel auf 27 Milliarden Dollar hoch.
Im Gesamtjahr 2024/25 verdiente Microsoft fast 102 Milliarden Dollar. Der Umsatz legte um 15 Prozent auf 282 Milliarden Dollar zu. Umsatz und Gewinn übertrafen die Erwartung der Experten deutlich. Die Aktie stieg im nachbörslichen US-Handel um fast neun Prozent. Sollte der Kurs am Donnerstag auch in dieser Größenordnung steigen, würde das Papier abermals ein Rekordhoch erreichen und der Börsenwert die Marke von vier Billionen Dollar überschreiten./so/DP/zb

author: VNExplorer
title: Warm weather threatens Italy's ski season while heavy rain is leaving French Alps slopes a washout
text:
Holidaymakers aiming to hit slopes in Italy and France are facing disappointment
Holidaymakers aiming to hit the slopes in Italy and France are facing disappointment as the warmest December in Italy in 130 years and heavy rain in the French Alps threaten to wipe out the ski season.
Italy’s northern region of Piedmont, experiencing its warmest December since the 1890s, has seen winter resorts shutting down runs due to a lack of snow.
Bardonecchia, a popular resort near the French border, has been particularly affected by a high-pressure weather system, with temperatures reaching as high as 16C in the depths of December.
Resorts in the Apennine mountains outside Rome, including Terminillo and Ovindoli, have also faced challenges with inadequate snow cover, leading to the closure of slopes despite busy Christmas bookings.
Meanwhile in France, the popular resorts of Morzine and Les Gets were forced to delay the opening of the ski season due to monsoon like downpours, with temperatures not cold enough to precipitate proper snowfall.
Though some light powder was dusted on the slopes in recent days, more rain is expected to overrun the slopes.
The disappointing conditions come after Spanish meteorologists warned that December temperatures across much of Western and Southern Europe would be far higher than normal.
Ruben del Campo, a spokesperson for Spain’s national weather agency, said earlier this month that the unseasonable heat, coupled with predictions of sparse rainfall until the end of February, heralded a ‘not very good’ season for winter sports that depend on abundant snow, which once melted is also a crucial water resource for the spring and summer months.
Bardonecchia, a popular resort near the French border, has been particularly affected by a high-pressure weather system, with temperatures reaching as high as 16C in the depths of December
Les Gets Ski Slope 29/12/23
Terminillo Ski Slope 29/12/23
Le Plateau de Nyon, Morzine Ski Slope 29/12/23
Temperatures across Spain in mid-December smashed records, pushing the mercury close to 30 degrees Celsius (86 Fahrenheit) in the south and delaying the start of the ski season.
And several regions of Italy normally ripe for skiing at this time of year have been far warmer than usual as temperatures in the Alpine city of Turin crested 20C the week before Christmas.
Enrico Rossi, director of the ski lift company Colomion and vice-president of the Bardonecchia tourism consortium, admitted that there was not enough snow to open all the slopes.
‘During this period last year, we had four more [slopes] open. We have given priority to the beginner slopes, making artificial snow for them. We are postponing the opening of the difficult ones, which are also the least crowded,’ he told The Telegraph.
Luca Mercalli, president of the Italian Meteorological Society, attributed the rise in temperatures to global warming and warned of a grim outlook for Alpine regions, saying the temperatures he had seen in December were akin to those expected in late summer.
‘The continuous increase in temperatures due to global warming will cause a further reduction in the winter season in the future, with more rain and less snow even at high altitudes.
‘In the days before Christmas, to find zero degrees celsius you had to go up to almost 3,000 metres [9,900ft] and these are temperatures we normally find in late summer,’ he added.
Sunset time in the Italian Alps, view of the town of Bardonecchia, Piedmont
FILE: A low-angle action shot of skiing action in the French ski resort of Morzine, in the European Alps
It comes after higher temperatures and adverse weather conditions wrought havoc on the skiing World Cup in early December.
Rainfall in the French Alps forced the cancellation of six races.
Sharing a statement on December 10, t he International Ski and Snowboard Federation said the men’s slalom – one of the centrepieces of the World Cup – could not start ‘due to the present slope conditions after last night’s rain and snow to ensure the safety and fairness for the racers.’
The scheduled start time already was pushed back Saturday in anticipation of course workers needing more time to clear the snow and ensure parts of the run which had been lashed by rain were safe to ski on.
The race likely will be rescheduled at a different venue later in the season.

author: Daniele Nalbone
title: Metalmeccanici: scioperi a Firenze e in Sardegna
text:
Lavoro
Metalmeccanici: scioperi a Firenze e in Sardegna
Lavoro In attesa dello sciopero nazionale unitario di domani, con manifestazioni regionali e provinciali in tutta Italia, ieri sono iniziati gli scioperi a Firenze, Prato e Pistoia e in Sardegna con […]
Lavoro In attesa dello sciopero nazionale unitario di domani, con manifestazioni regionali e provinciali in tutta Italia, ieri sono iniziati gli scioperi a Firenze, Prato e Pistoia e in Sardegna con […]
Edizione del 27 marzo 2025Edizione 27.03.2025
In attesa dello sciopero nazionale unitario di domani, con manifestazioni regionali e provinciali in tutta Italia, ieri sono iniziati gli scioperi a Firenze, Prato e Pistoia e in Sardegna con un’altissima adesione di lavoratori.
La mobilitazione intende riaprire la trattativa con Federmeccanica e Assistal per il rinnovo del contratto collettivo nazionale di lavoro, dopo la rottura della trattativa e le 16 ore di sciopero già effettuate tra dicembre e febbraio.
Fim, Fiom, Uilm hanno indetto un’altra giornata di fermo con l’obiettivo di aumentare i salari e rafforzare la sicurezza.
La manifestazione di Torino vedrà le conclusioni del segretario generale della Fim-Cisl, Ferdinando Uliano, a Reggio Emilia ci sarà il segretario generale della Fiom-Cgil, Michele De Palma, e a Napoli quello della Uilm-Uil, Rocco Palombella.
ABBONAMENTI
Passa dalla parte del torto.
Sostieni l’informazione libera e senza padroni.
Leggi senza limiti il manifesto su sito e app.
I consigli di mema

author: @nadine_morton
title: NSW cop charged with shoplifting in Berry to face court | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: A police officer accused of stealing has been told to face court for his alleged crime. The male officer allegedly [stole from a shop](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8660346/illawarra-retailers-face-theft-crisis-amid-falling-home-break-ins/) on Queen Street at Berry on Sunday, July 7. "Following inquiries, today [Thursday, August 15], a 51-year-old constable attached to a specialist command was issued a court attendance notice for shoplifting value less than or equal to $2000," a [NSW Police](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/news/court-crime/) spokesperson said. "The officer's employment status is under review." He will appear at [Nowra Local Court](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/news/court-crime/) on Tuesday, September 24. The charges comes as the NSW Police force faces intense public scrutiny over a number of recent separate issues. Commissioner Karen Webb was [cleared of misconduct over bottles of gin](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8722765/police-chief-cleared-of-misconduct-over-bottles-of-gin/), and separately two [police officers accused of assaulting an elderly man in Picton](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8720904/cops-to-fight-allegations-of-assaulting-elderly-man/) on January 21, 2024, are fighting charges stemming from the incident. Meanwhile, former NSW police officer Beaumont Lamarre-Condon, who allegedly killed two men - including one he briefly dated - has this week formally been charged with their [domestic violence-related murders](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8728148/ex-cop-faces-court-on-double-dv-murder-charges/). DAILY Today's top stories curated by our news team. Also includes evening update.

author: Purepeople
title: 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate': quase 20 anos após o icônico filme, veja como estão as crianças do longa hoje - e se choque com as mudanças
text:
'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate' moldou a infância de muita gente e foi um completo sucesso desde o seu lançamento, que aconteceu em julho de 2005. Hoje, quase 20 anos depois da estreia do icônico filme, os atores que deram vida às crianças do longa impressionam com suas transformações.
Marcado pela atuação primorosa de [Johnny Depp](/famosos/johnny-depp_p46) como o [excêntrico Willy Wonka](/noticia/-wonka-e-lancado-e-gera-briga-entre-johnny-depp-e-timothee-chalamet-entenda-a-treta-envolvendo-os-dois-atores_a380404/1), o clássico filme de Tim Burton também é lembrado pelas crianças de diferentes personalidades que protagonizaram um passeio cheio de surpresas pela fábrica de chocolates.
Mas como serão que esses atores mirins estão hoje? Prestes a completar duas décadas, você vai simplesmente se chocar com suas atuais aparências e escolhas de carreiras. Será que você se lembra de cada uma das crianças de 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate'?
Protagonista de 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate', Freddie Highmore, atualmente com 32 anos, deu vida à Charlie Bucket, o menino fofo que conquistou o coração de todos. Ele continuou com sua carreira na atuação e conquistou outros papeis icônicos desde então. [Quem nunca viu seu rosto em 'The Good Doctor'](/noticia/quem-e-o-the-good-doctor-da-vida-real-veja-essa-e-mais-curiosidades-sobre-a-serie_a351369/1) (O Bom Doutor), ou em 'Bates Motel', certamente não está vivendo direito.
Julia Winter interpretou a mimada Veruca Salt no longa e, ao contrário do protagonista do filme, não seguiu com sua carreira artística depois da infância. A ex-atriz ainda participou de alguns projetos pequenos entre 2005 e 2006, mas escolheu a carreira de medicina, tendo feito mestrado em oncologia e atualmente, aos 31 anos, está cursando o doutorado em cirurgia e medicina molecular.
O egoísta Mike Taevee fez raiva em muita gente em 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate' graças ao talento do ator Jordan Fry, que seguiu a carreira na atuação com alguns projetos menos conhecidos, como 'The Journey' e 'Gone'. Também dublador, o astro de 31 anos colocou sua voz no longa 'A Família do Futuro'.
Quem não se lembra de Violet Beauregarde, a icônica mascadora de chicletes do longa? AnnaSophia Robb, hoje com 31 anos e ainda atuando, foi outra estrela que continuou sua carreira em grande destaque nos cinemas. Entre seus projetos estão 'A Montanha Enfeitiçada' e a série 'The Act', [que conta a história de Gypsy Rose](/noticia/como-esta-gypsy-rose-hoje-em-dia-condenada-pelo-assassinato-da-mae-abusiva-ela-anunciou-gravidez-e-se-divorciou-7-meses-apos-prisao_a393852/1).
Por outro lado, Philip Wiegratz, que deu vida ao comilão Augustus Gloop, acabou desistindo da carreira na atuação em meados de 2013, quando fez seu último filme. Sem trabalhos tão expressivos a nível mundial desde 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate', o ex-ator hoje tem 31 anos e vive se aventurando com a família e amigos e quase não compartilha informações pessoais na web.
Veja o antes e depois das crianças de 'A Fantástica Fábrica de Chocolate' acessando a galeria!

author: sina.com.cn
title: 在嘉兴经开，不能没有春天的仪式感|嘉兴市_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
转自：嘉兴日报
　　昨天上午，嘉兴经开区长水街道嘉南社区开展“社企携手植新绿 共育文明树新风”植树节活动。■摄影 通讯员 莫雅娟 记者 徐志达 　　■记者 钟淑婷 谭心仪
　　春满三月天，植绿正当时。连日来，嘉兴经开区以“绿”为媒开展了一系列丰富多彩的主题活动，通过义务植树及护苗绿书签等活动，在为环境添绿的同时，也为孩子的成长充“植”。
　　“植”此青绿！一起去种树
　　3月11日下午，沐浴着春日暖阳，嘉兴经开区建设交通局、资规分局、智慧城市公司共同组织开展了植树活动，50多名机关职工来到嘉兴市区三环南路与城南路交叉口东南侧绿地植树护绿，以实际行动为城市生态环境建设贡献力量。
　　活动现场，大家热情高涨、干劲十足，或两人一组，或三五成队，在专业园林工人的指导下，分工协作，挥锹挖坑、放苗扶正、填土踩实、提桶浇水，认真对待每一个种植步骤。
　　“种好一棵树蛮不容易的，但过程很充实、有意义。”来自区智慧城市公司的池静和同事合力栽下一棵银杏树，在植树过程中，他还向园林工人详细了解树木品种、生长习性、后续养护等知识。
　　此外，为了保护野生动物多样性，活动现场还张贴了保护鸟类的宣传标语，营造良好的鸟类保护氛围。
　　种下的是绿色树苗，更是经开生态发展的美好未来。嘉兴经开区建设交通局城市建设科相关工作人员表示，希望以此次植树节活动为契机，持续擦亮生态底色，号召更多居民加入爱绿护绿行列，共同参与行道树补种、社区小微绿地建设，守护绿色家园。
　　经开人的爱木护林不仅体现在种植新苗上，对于古树也格外用心。经开共有16株古树，这些古树均位于塘汇街道章氏古茶园内，其中15株为茶树，另一株为白杜，树龄都在300年左右。为更好地保护、利用章氏古茶园珍贵历史资源，塘汇街道开展章氏古茶园及周边公园综合提升改造工程，进一步提升绿化环境、完善配套设施，也让古树在保护中焕发新活力。
　　近年来，嘉兴经开区持续加大绿化建设投入，全力打造群众共享的绿意空间。截至目前，经开区绿化覆盖率达44.25%，乔灌木覆盖面积62.01%，行道树及公共绿地内大乔木30余万株，树木品种约115种，人均公园绿地面积达25.82平方米，“开窗见绿、出门见林”已是经开居民的生活常态。
　　爱苗护苗！守护孩子健康成长
　　3月11日下午，在嘉兴市茶园小学内，一场“育植未来·护苗成长”主题活动，拉开了嘉兴经开区“护苗2025·绿书签”春季专场的序幕。
　　“现在是下课时间，小朋友们，让我们走出教室，放松一下吧！”随着下课铃响，在茶园小学的操场上，经开区的护苗IP——“经小苗”，带着茶园小学的师生演绎了情景剧——《绿色阅读 伴我成长》，讲述了“小小护苗使者”坚持绿色阅读的向阳故事。
　　“护苗活动开展以来，学生越来越认同绿色阅读、健康上网的理念，刚刚这些都是同学们自己想的剧本，自己排练的。”嘉兴市茶园小学校长莫雨勤介绍，本次活动特地安排在课间15分钟内，鼓励孩子们走出教室，到户外享受绿意、感受春光。
　　“看，我挖出了一个萝卜！”“老师，你帮我看看，我这样算种好了吗？”在学校操场边的一米茶园种植空间内，在老师的带领下，学生和家长代表共同栽下“成长绿苗”。
　　“学生很喜欢这片‘校园农场’，平时浇水、施肥这些养护工作都是由他们自己完成的。”莫雨勤介绍：“今天的护苗主题活动我们安排了两组内容同时进行，一个是在一米茶园种植基地开展种植蔬菜活动，另一个是在学校的护苗工作站开展‘护苗+非遗’手工拓印活动。”
　　作为嘉兴市首批“护苗工作站”，茶园小学自去年起就开始探索把种植活动和护苗活动相结合，旨在通过绿色实践与护苗相融合的形式，打造健康、美丽的校园环境，也为青少年营造健康向上的成长环境。
　　近年来，嘉兴经开区通过常态化开展“扫黄打非”知识普及和宣传工作，引导青少年自觉抵制有害思想和文化侵袭，构建学校、家庭、社区全方位参与的“护苗”阵地，共同呵护青少年健康成长。
